alert.note: Alert for Flathead, Mission Valleys; Kootenai, Cabinet Region; West Glacier Region (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 9:58AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Lake and central Flathead Counties through 1045 AM MDT... At 956 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Woods Bay, or 18 miles southeast of Kalispell, moving northeast at 40 mph. If you are on Flathead Lake take shelter. Lightning and gusty winds up to 30 mph or higher, is expected to quickly develop in the next 10-15 minutes. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Woods Bay, Bigfork, Proctor, Somers, Lakeside, Rollins and Dayton. This includes the following highways... Highway 83 between mile markers 77 and 90. Highway 93 between mile markers 80 and 106. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.

area.areaDesc: Flathead, Mission Valleys; Kootenai, Cabinet Region; West Glacier Region
